title: Convert amounts into first equation

title: Isolate Variable
text: Let's use the first equation to isolate $$b$$. With the equation, we can subtract a from both sides to get $$b=21, 540-f$$

text: We can plug in $$b=21, 540-f$$ using the second equation to get $$0.105(21,540-f)f+0.059=1,669.68$$

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation after plugging in "b" would be $$2, 261.7-0.046f=1, 669.68$$. We now isolate the variable "f" and get $$-0.046f=-592.02$$. Then, we can divide both sides by $$-0.046$$ to get $$f=12, 870$$.

title: Solve for c
